parameter.name: $PC_TRAFO_NUM
parameter.description:
The variable contains the value 0, if no kinematic transformation or the persistent transformation is active.
If a conventionally defined (i.e. not by kinematic chains) transformation is active, the variable contains the number of the current transformation data set (the number n in the machine data $MC_TRAFO_TYPE_n).
With an active TRACON transformation, the data set number of the TRACON transformation is returned, in other words, not the data set number of one of the included, chained part transformations.
If a transformation defined by kinematic chains is active, the variable contains the number of the $NT data set with an offset of 1000, this means that the first transformation returns the value 1001. In this case, the system variable then returns the same value as $P_TRAFO_PARSET.

parameter.name: $AC_TOOL_O_CORR_DIR
parameter.description:
Active override of the tool orientation in different coordinate systems:
$AC_TOOL_O_CORR_DIR[n,i] n = 1, 2, 3: Components of the vector i = 0, 1, 2: Coordinate system (0 : BCS, 1: PCS, 2: SZS)
This vector is the direction vector of the plane created by the two vectors $AC_TOOL_O_CORR and $AC_TOOL_O_ACT.

parameter.name: $AC_TOOL_O_CORR_ANGLE
parameter.description: This system variable returns the angle in degrees between the two vectors $AC_TOOL_O_CORR and $AC_TOOL_O_ACT. This angle does not depend on the coordinate system in which the direction vector $AC_TOOL_O_CORR_DIR[] is read. If no override of the orientation is active in the interpolator, this angle is 0.0

parameter.name: $AC_TOOL_R_CORR_DIR
parameter.brief: Active override of the rotation vector of the orientation
parameter.description:
Active override of the rotation of the tool orientation in different coordinate systems (only with 6-axis kinematics):
$AC_TOOL_R_CORR_DIR[n,i] n = 1, 2, 3: Components of the vector i = 0, 1, 2: Coordinate system (0 : BCS, 1: PCS, 2: SZS)
This vector is the direction vector of the plane created by the two vectors $AC_TOOL_R_CORR and $AC_TOOL_R_ACT.

parameter.name: $AC_TOOL_R_CORR_ANGLE
parameter.brief: Active override of the rotation of the orientation
parameter.description: This system variable returns the angle in degrees between the two vectors $AC_TOOL_R_CORR and $AC_TOOL_R_ACT. This angle does not depend on the coordinate system in which the direction vector $AC_TOOL_R_CORR_DIR[] is read. If no override of the orientation is active in the interpolator, this angle is 0.0

parameter.name: $P_NCKTYPE
parameter.description:
The system variable returns the NCK type.
6000: SOLUTIONLINE 10700: 840D sl 14000: 802D sl T/M 14000: 802D sl N/G o. C/U 14500: 808D 15000: 840Di sl 16000: 828D

parameter.name: $AN_CUTRACE
parameter.brief: Trigger variable for the SINAMICS trace function
parameter.description:
Writing the value 1 when using telegram 390, 391 or 395 sets bit 4 in all Control Units in drive parameter r898 "Control word drive object 1" activated by MD13120 $MN_CONTROL_UNIT_LOGIC_ADDRESS.
The trigger tripped by the telegram must have previously been parameterized in the trace.
The variable has the following values:
Write: 0: No action 1: Trip trigger
Read: Always 0 because the trigger cannot be read back

parameter.name: $VA_TRACK_ERR_CONTR
parameter.description: The variable $VA_TRACK_ERR_CONTR[X] returns the control deviation at the input of the position controller
